problem_text: Figure 22-40 shows a proton (p) on the central axis through a disk with a uniform charge density due to excess electrons. The disk is seen from an edge-on view. Three of those electrons are shown: electron $\mathrm{e}_c$ at the disk center and electrons $\mathrm{e}_s$ at opposite sides of the disk, at radius $R$ from the center. The proton is initially at distance $z=R=2.00 \mathrm{~cm}$ from the disk. At that location, what is the magnitude of the electric field $\vec{E}_c$ due to electron $\mathrm{e}_c$?
